definition: tone mark on a Chinese syllable (i.e. accents on ā á ǎ à)/(music) key signature
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: I might not know what key he's in.
sentences.chinese: 我可能不知道他所使用的调号。

sentences.english: They are needed when chromatic notes foreign to the key and not indicated in the key-signature occur.
sentences.chinese: 当半音不属于该调，并且无调号时需要加变音记号。

definition: names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
a note on a musical scale
(music) accidental (symbol such as a sharp (♯), flat (♭), natural (♮) etc)
(music) accidental (a note foreign to the key signature)
triad/musical chord of three notes, such as major triad do-mi-so
